testCases.title: Verify filtering is enabled on all columns of the transaction list
preconditions: User is logged into the application
User has access to the transaction list
steps: Navigate to the transaction list page.
Check each column header for a filter option.
Apply a filter to each column one by one.
expectedResults: Each column header should have a filter option available.
Applying a filter should update the transaction list to show only the filtered results.
postconditions: Filters are applied and visible on the transaction list.

testCases.title: Verify sorting functionality works correctly with applied filters
preconditions: User is logged into the application
User has access to the transaction list
A filter is applied to one or more columns
steps: Apply a filter to a column in the transaction list.
Sort the filtered list by a different column.
Observe the order of the transactions.
expectedResults: The transaction list should be sorted based on the selected column, considering only the filtered results.
postconditions: The transaction list remains sorted and filtered as per the user's actions.

testCases.title: Verify help guide is updated with filtering instructions
preconditions: User is logged into the application
User has access to the help guide
steps: Navigate to the help guide section of the application.
Search for instructions related to filtering the transaction list.
expectedResults: The help guide should contain updated instructions on how to use the filtering feature on the transaction list.
postconditions: User understands how to apply filters using the help guide.

testCases.title: Verify transaction graph does not refresh based on chosen filters
preconditions: User is logged into the application
User has access to the transaction list and graph
steps: Apply a filter to the transaction list.
Observe the transaction graph for any changes.
expectedResults: The transaction graph should remain unchanged regardless of the filters applied to the transaction list.
postconditions: The transaction graph remains static despite list filters.

testCases.title: Verify Copilot is unaware of filters applied by the user
preconditions: User is logged into the application
User has access to the transaction list and Copilot
steps: Apply a filter to the transaction list.
Ask a question to Copilot that would typically require knowledge of the transaction list state.
expectedResults: Copilot should respond without considering the filters applied by the user.
postconditions: Copilot's response is independent of the transaction list filters.

testCases.title: Verify refreshing the graph and list resets user-selected filters
preconditions: User is logged into the application
User has access to the transaction list and graph
steps: Apply a filter to the transaction list.
Trigger a refresh of the graph and list through a Copilot query.
Observe the transaction list for filter status.
expectedResults: The transaction list should reset to its original state, removing any user-applied filters.
postconditions: The transaction list is reset, and no filters are applied.
